intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. muelleri, commonly known as Mueller's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces small, heart-shaped leaves and has a compact growth habit. Mueller's eyebright is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
